abstract: Darren Robbins, the screen printing company’s co-founder, responds to reader comments.
snippet: Darren Robbins, the screen printing company’s co-founder, responds to reader comments.
lead_paragraph: Last week, we published a case study that explored whether Big D Custom Screen Printing could become profitable by specializing in small T-shirt orders. After a year in business, the company had sales of $325,000 on which it suffered a nominal loss. Big D’s co-founder, Darren Robbins, and his partner disagreed as to the best way to turn things around. His partner wanted to focus on large corporate accounts. Mr. Robbins believed Big D could thrive by targeting customers with small orders — as small as one T-shirt. The partners split (amicably) over the issue.

headline.main: Was Big D Wise to Pursue Small Customers?
